name: setzkin
text: Wrong! 120, loser!

name: aelindil
text:
What is the saddest thing?

Schizophrenia.

name: tekende
text: Scizophrenia is not the same as multiple personality disorder, or, as it is now called (despite there never having been a single provable case of it), dissociative identity disorder.

name: aelindil
text:
Oh, I know this. My uncle is schizophrenic, and he talks to himself in much the same way that setzkin did many a month ago.

Let this be a lesson, kids. LSD will fuck you up.

name: snoogatron
text: i think we have the same uncle

name: boredom_man
text: I'm sorry, what are you two doing in my bathroom again?

name: woodenteeth
text:
As your resident Learned Friend, I lend my support. Auditory Hallucinations attacking your character are common. Though they are often considered by the affected as a demon or some such. In the end though, it's all Your Voice, as demonstrated in setzkin's posts above.

Here endeth the lesson.

text: rock solid five!

name: lawbot
text: The Lie Bot panel is excellent. BITTER AND SWEET.

name: baryonyx
text: It always irritates me when movies bundle "Bloopers" into the special features. It's like watching five minutes of people stop in mid-conversation, scrunch up their faces, and then start laughing at nothing apparent and maybe exchange an inside joke, and you're expected to derive some enjoyment from viewing it.

name: semiquaver
text: It always irritates me when people start babbling grumpily and pointlessly.  Plus, I like blooper reels.  Nyah.

oh the ones where he hurts himself every damn scene. Oh yea.
Its like you watch the movie and go "man lets go fucking jump some trash cans right now!" Then you turn and see Jackie just wrack himself so hardcore he doesn't get up for a minute...
"maybe we shouldn't...yea"

name: bixschmix
text: This is the first Achewood where I laughed out loud for a prolonged period of time. So amazing.

name: hamscout
text:
FIVED.
Phillipe all Nelson Muntz-in' at the card table...
The cast and crew fallin' out the place when Lie Bot hits ya wit da truf...
The camera panning away from the manual to reveal an apple-cheeked Onstad, wiping away the tears as the theme from the outtakes at the end of 'Smoky and the Bandit' plays...
